str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
Just as, as, even as. From hos and per; just as, i.e. Exactly like.
From hamartano; a sin.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I rule, reign, (b) I reign over. From basileus; to rule.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
And, even, also, namely.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I rule, reign, (b) I reign over. From basileus; to rule.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From dikaios; equity; specially justification.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From aion; perpetual.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
